Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the addition of a fresh egg was the sole reason for the success of instant cake mixes, without considering other factors that may have contributed to their improved sales.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that instant cake mixes sold poorly until the addition of a fresh egg was required.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the success of instant cake mixes may have been influenced by factors other than the addition of a fresh egg, indicating the presence of alternative explanations for their improved sales.
